title: Hybrid Rebuttal Planner Questionnaire
description: A structured step-by-step questionnaire for writing conference rebuttals inspired by Devi Parikh’s guide and Anubhav Shrimal’s Research Paper Planner.

questions.q: General impression of reviews (misunderstandings, strong criticisms, mostly minor, etc.)
For each reviewer, list 2–3 positive or accurate observations they made.
What is the single core message you want the Area Chair to take away after reading your rebuttal?
List your top 2–3 strongest contributions or evidence (numbers, experiments, novelty, etc.)

sections.title: Decompose Reviewer Criticisms into Atomic Items
sections.instructions: Repeat the following block for every individual reviewer comment.

fields_per_comment.q: Your interpretation of the reviewer’s concern
Is the answer already in your paper? (If yes, point to line/figure/table)
Is the requested experiment feasible within rebuttal time & rules?
If infeasible, what alternative evidence can you provide?
Would this benefit from numerical/statistical evidence? If yes, specify.

sections.title: Consolidate Overlapping Issues
sections.instructions: Merge similar comments across reviewers into unified concerns.

questions.q: Rank consolidated concerns in order of importance (1 = highest)
List the 2–3 strongest and most convincing responses
Choose the tone for the rebuttal
Summarize the main positive feedback / strengths of your paper (1–2 sentences).
State your intent to address key concerns (1 sentence).
List which consolidated concerns you’ll respond to, in priority order.

sections.title: Final Assembly (Rebuttal Text)
sections.instructions: Assemble the full rebuttal body here.

questions.q: Body — for each concern, paste: (a) short paraphrased concern, (b) concise reply, (c) supporting bullet or pointer
Suggested short note to AC (1–2 sentences)

sections.title: Quality Check
checklist: All reviewer comments itemized and answered
Concise replies (≤40 words) for each concern
Feasible experiments listed or alternatives provided
